And Gilead with the territory of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and all Mount Hermon and all Bashan unto Salecah;
All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (he was left of the remnant of the Rephaim); and Moses [xref]a[/xref]struck them and dispossessed them.
Yet the children of Israel did not dispossess the Geshurites and the Maacathites, but Geshur and Maacath dwell in the midst of Israel to this day.
However to the tribe of Levi he did not give an [xref]a[/xref]inheritance; the [note]1[/note]offerings of Jehovah the God of Israel by fire are their inheritance, as He had spoken to him.
verse.note: See notes [link book="Num." chapter="18"]9[sup]1[/sup][/link], [link book="Num." chapter="18"]21[sup]1[/sup][/link], and [link]28[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 18[/link].

verse.text: And Moses gave [i]an inheritance[/i] to the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their families.
And for them the border was from [xref]a[/xref]Aroer, which is on the edge of the river Arnon, and [i]from[/i] the city, which is in the middle of the river valley, and all the tableland by Medeba;
Heshbon and all its cities which are in the tableland: Dibon and Bamoth-baal and Beth-baal-meon
And Jahaz and Kedemoth and Mephaath
And Kiriathaim and Sibmah and Zereth-shahar on the mountain of the valley
And Beth-peor and the slopes of Pisgah and Beth-jeshimoth;

That is, all the cities of the tableland and all the kingdom of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon [i]and[/i] whom Moses [xref]a[/xref]struck with the leaders of Midian: Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, the princes of Sihon who inhabited the land.
And Balaam the son of Beor, who practiced divination, the children of Israel slew with the sword with those of them who were [i]already[/i] slain.
And the border of the children of Reuben was the Jordan and [i]its[/i] border. This is the inheritance of the children of Reuben according to their families, the cities with their villages.
And Moses gave [i]an inheritance[/i] to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad, according to their families.
And for them the border was Jazer and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon to Aroer, which is before Rabbah;
And from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim; and from [xref]a[/xref]Mahanaim to the border of Debir;

And in the valley Beth-haram and Beth-nimrah and Succoth and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon the king of Heshbon; the Jordan and its border to the end of the Sea of Chinnereth, across the Jordan on the east.
This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities with their villages.
And Moses gave [i]an inheritance[/i] to the half-tribe of Manasseh; and it was for the half-tribe of the children of Manasseh according to their families.
And their border was from Mahanaim [i]and[/i] all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og the king of Bashan, and all the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]tent villages of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities;
verse.note: Or, Havvoth-jair (cf. [link]Num. 32:41[/link]).

verse.text: And half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Machir, according to their families.
These are what Moses gave as inheritances in the plains of Moab across the Jordan at Jericho to the east.
But to the tribe of Levi Moses did not give an [xref]a[/xref]inheritance; [note]1[/note]Jehovah the God of Israel is their inheritance, as He had spoken to them.
verse.note: See note [link]20[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 18[/link].

verse.text: And these are what the children of Israel received as [xref]a[/xref]inheritances in the land of Canaan, which [xref]b[/xref]Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the heads of the fathers' [i]houses[/i] of the tribes of the children of Israel gave to them as inheritances,
By the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]lot of their inheritance, as Jehovah commanded through Moses for the nine tribes and the half-tribe.
verse.note: The way the good land was divided among the different tribes was by casting lots. In this book the word lot is used in the sense of casting lots ([link]18:6[/link], [link]8[/link], [link]10[/link]). The outcome of the casting of lots was according to what God had foreordained. For example, according to God's ordination, Jerusalem and the surrounding district were for Judah ([link]15:63[/link]), out of whom Christ would come ([link]Micah 5:2[/link]; [link]Heb. 7:14[/link]). Nevertheless, this still had to be realized by the casting of lots. God's ordaining hand was present in the casting of lots to direct the result ([link]Prov. 16:33[/link]). Thus, the dividing of the land did not depend on Joshua or on the high priest but only on God. As a result, there was no ground for the tribes to complain about the portion of the land allotted to them. The way of allotting the land was fair, and it caused everyone to be subdued.

verse.text: For Moses had given the inheritance of the [xref]a[/xref]two tribes and the half-tribe across the Jordan;[separator]but to the [xref]b[/xref]Levites he did not give an inheritance among them.

For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim; and they gave no portion to the Levites in the land, but only [xref]a[/xref]cities to dwell in with their pasture lands for their cattle and their substance.
As Jehovah had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did; thus they divided the land.

Then the children of Judah approached Joshua in Gilgal; and [xref]a[/xref]Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, You know the [xref]b[/xref]word that Jehovah spoke to Moses the man of God concerning me and concerning you in Kadesh-barnea.
I was forty years old when Moses the servant of Jehovah sent me out from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land; and I [xref]a[/xref]returned such a word to him as was [i]genuinely[/i] upon my heart.
However my brothers who went up with me made the people's heart [xref]a[/xref]melt, but I fully [xref]b[/xref]followed Jehovah my God.

And Moses swore on that day, saying, Surely the land on which your foot has [xref]a[/xref]trodden will be an inheritance to you and to your children forever, for you have fully followed Jehovah my God.

And now, look, Jehovah has kept me alive, as He said, for these forty-five years, since the time Jehovah spoke this word to Moses while Israel walked through the wilderness. And now, look, today I am eighty-five years old.
Today I am still as [xref]a[/xref]strong as [i]I was[/i] on the day Moses sent me out; as my strength was then, so my strength is now, for battle and for going out and coming in.

Now therefore give me this hill country, of which Jehovah spoke on that day, for you heard on that day that the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Anakim were there with great fortified cities. It may be that Jehovah will be with me, and I will dispossess them, as Jehovah said.
verse.note: See [link]Num. 13:33[/link] and note.

verse.text: So Joshua blessed him; and he gave [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Hebron to Caleb the son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
verse.note: Meaning [i]fellowship, communion,[/i] or [i]friendship.[/i]

verse.text: Therefore Hebron has become the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day because he fully followed Jehovah the God of Israel.
And the name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba. (This [i]Arba[/i] was the greatest man among the Anakim.) And the land had rest from war.

[xref]a[/xref]And the lot for the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families was unto the border of Edom, [i]to[/i] the wilderness of Zin at the south; [i]this was[/i] the southern extreme.
And their southern border was from the end of the Salt Sea, from the tongue-shaped bay that faces south;
And it went southward to the ascent of Akrabbim, and passed on to Zin, and went up south of Kadesh-barnea, and passed on to Hezron, and went up to Addar, and went around Karka,
And passed on to Azmon, and went out to the brook of Egypt; and the end of the border was at the sea. This shall be your southern border.
And the eastern border was the Salt Sea to the end of the Jordan. And the [xref]a[/xref]border on the northern side was from the bay of the sea at the end of the Jordan.
And the border went up to Beth-hoglah, and passed on to the north of Beth-arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben;

And the border went up to Debir from the Valley of Achor, and turned northward toward Gilgal, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, which is south of the river valley; and the border passed on to the waters of En-shemesh; and its end was at En-rogel;

Then the border went up by the [note]1[/note]Valley of Ben-hinnom to the south of the [xref]a[/xref]Jebusite slope (this is Jerusalem); and the border went to the top of the mountain that is before the Valley of Hinnom on the west, which is the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim;
verse.note: Or, the valley of the son of Hinnom; Heb. [i]Ge-ben-hinnom.[/i] It is also called the Valley of Hinnom (in this verse; [link]18:16[/link]; [link]Neh. 11:30[/link]), which in Hebrew is [i]Ge-hinnom. Gehenna[/i] in the New Testament corresponds to it ([link]Matt. 5:22[/link] and note 8).

verse.text: And the border turned from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah and went to the cities of Mount Ephron; then the border turned toward Baalah (this is Kiriath-jearim);

And the border went around west of Baalah to Mount Seir, and passed by the northern slope of Mount Jearim (this is Chesalon), and went down to [xref]a[/xref]Beth-shemesh, and passed on to [xref]b[/xref]Timnah;
And the border went to the slope of [xref]a[/xref]Ekron northward; and the border turned toward Shikkeron, and passed by Mount Baalah, and went to Jabneel; and the end of the border was at the sea.
And the western border was the Great Sea and its coast. This is the border of the children of Judah all around according to their families.

And to [xref]a[/xref]Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a portion in the midst of the children of Judah according to the commandment of Jehovah to Joshua, that is, Kiriath-arba ([i]Arba[/i] was the father of [note]1[/note]Anak); this is Hebron.
verse.note: See [link]Num. 13:33[/link] and note.

verse.text: And Caleb drove out the three sons of [xref]a[/xref]Anak from there: Sheshai and Ahiman and Talmai, the children of Anak.
[xref]a[/xref]And he went up from there to the inhabitants of Debir. (Now the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher.)
And Caleb said, Whoever strikes Kiriath-sepher and takes it, I will give to him Achsah my daughter as wife.
Then [xref]a[/xref]Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's brother, took it; and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.
And when she came [i]to him,[/i] she urged him to ask her father for a field. And she alighted from [i]her[/i] donkey, and Caleb said to her, What do you want?
And she said, Give me a blessing, for you have given me land in the Negev; give me also springs of water. So he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
And the uttermost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the border of Edom on the south were Kabzeel and Eder and Jagur
And Kinah and Dimonah and Adadah
And Kedesh and Hazor and Ithnan;
Ziph and Telem and Bealoth
And Hazor-hadattah and Kerioth-hezron (this is Hazor);
Amam and Shema and Moladah
And Hazar-gaddah and Heshmon and Beth-pelet
And Hazar-shual and [xref]a[/xref]Beer-sheba and Biziothiah;
Baalah and Iim and Ezem
And Eltolad and Chesil and Hormah
And [xref]a[/xref]Ziklag and Madmannah and Sansannah
And Lebaoth and Shilhim and Ain and Rimmon: in all twenty-nine cities with their villages.
In the lowland: [xref]a[/xref]Eshtaol and Zorah and Ashnah
And Zanoah and En-gannim; Tappuah and Enam;
Jarmuth and Adullam; Socoh and Azekah
And Shaaraim and Adithaim and Gederah and Gederothaim: fourteen cities with their villages.
Zenan and Hadashah and Migdal-gad
And Dilean and Mizpeh and Joktheel;
Lachish and Bozkath and Eglon
And Cabbon and Lahmas and Chitlish
And Gederoth; Beth-dagon and Naamah and Makkedah: sixteen cities with their villages.
Libnah and Ether and Ashan
And Iphtah and Ashnah and Nezib
And Keilah and Achzib and Mareshah: nine cities with their villages.
Ekron, with its [note]1[/note]towns and its villages;
verse.note: Lit., daughters. So also twice in [link]v. 47[/link], and in [link]17:11[/link], [link]16[/link].

verse.text: From Ekron even to the sea, all that were near Ashdod, with their villages.
Ashdod, [i]with[/i] its towns and its villages; Gaza, [i]with[/i] its towns and its villages, unto the brook of Egypt and the Great Sea and [i]its[/i] border.
And in the hill country: Shamir and Jattir and Socoh
And Dannah and Kiriath-sannah (this is Debir)
And Anab and Eshtemoh and Anim
And Goshen and Holon and Giloh: eleven cities with their villages.
Arab and Dumah and Eshan
And Janum and Beth-tappuah and Aphekah
And Humtah and Kiriath-arba (this is [xref]a[/xref]Hebron) and Zior: nine cities with their villages.
[xref]a[/xref]Maon, Carmel, and Ziph; and Juttah
And Jezreel and Jokdeam and Zanoah;
Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten cities with their villages.
Halhul, Beth-zur, and Gedor;
And Maarath and Beth-anoth and Eltekon: six cities with their villages.
Kiriath-baal (this is Kiriath-jearim) and Rabbah: two cities with their villages.
In the wilderness: Beth-arabah, Middin, and Secacah;
And Nibshan and the City of Salt and [xref]a[/xref]En-gedi: six cities with their villages.

But as for the [xref]a[/xref]Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah could not [xref]b[/xref]dispossess them; thus the Jebusites dwell with the children of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.

And the lot for the children of Joseph went [xref]a[/xref]from the Jordan at [xref]b[/xref]Jericho, east of the waters of Jericho, to the wilderness, going up from Jericho into the hill country to Bethel,
And went from [xref]a[/xref]Bethel to Luz, and passed on to the border of the Archites at Ataroth,
And went down westward to the border of the Japhletites, to the border of Lower Beth-horon and to Gezer; and its end was the sea.
And the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, received their inheritance.
And the border of the children of Ephraim according to their families was [i]thus:[/i] The border for their inheritance on the east was [i]from[/i] Ataroth-addar to Upper Beth-horon;
And the border went to the sea. [xref]a[/xref]On the north was Michmethath, and the border went around eastward to Taanath-shiloh, and passed by it to the east of Janoah,
And went down from Janoah to Ataroth, then to Naarah, and reached Jericho, and went to the Jordan.
From Tappuah the border went westward to the brook of Kanah; and its end was the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim according to their families,
Together with the cities that were set apart for the children of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.
[xref]a[/xref]Yet they did not dispossess the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer, but the Canaanites dwell in the midst of Ephraim to this day and have become [xref]b[/xref]forced labor.

And [i]this[/i] was the lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was Joseph's [xref]a[/xref]firstborn. To [xref]b[/xref]Machir, the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, Gilead and Bashan had been [i]given,[/i] since he was a man of war.

Therefore [i]the lot[/i] was for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their [xref]a[/xref]families: for the children of Abiezer and for the children of Helek and for the children of Asriel and for the children of Shechem and for the children of Hepher and for the children of Shemida; these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.

But [xref]a[/xref]Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but [note]1[/note]daughters. And these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verse.note: For [link]vv. 3-4[/link], see notes in [link]Num. 27:1-11[/link].

verse.text: And they came before [xref]a[/xref]Eleazar the priest and before Joshua the son of Nun and before the leaders, saying, Jehovah commanded Moses to give us an [xref]b[/xref]inheritance among our brothers. Therefore he gave them an inheritance among their father's brothers according to the commandment of Jehovah.
And ten portions fell to Manasseh, besides the [xref]a[/xref]land of Gilead and Bashan, which is across the Jordan,
Because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons. And the land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the children of Manasseh.
[xref]a[/xref]And the border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which was opposite Shechem; and the border went south to the inhabitants of En-tappuah.
The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but Tappuah, on the border of Manasseh, belonged to the children of Ephraim.

And the border went down to the brook of Kanah. These cities to the south of the brook belonged to Ephraim, among the cities of Manasseh; and the border of Manasseh was to the north of the brook, and its end was the sea.
To the south was Ephraim's, and to the north was Manasseh's, and the sea was his border. And they touched Asher on the north and Issachar on the east.

And to Manasseh there belonged in Issachar and Asher, Beth-shean and its towns, and Ibleam and its towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, and the inhabitants of En-dor and its towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns (the third is Napheth).
[xref]a[/xref]Yet the children of Manasseh could not dispossess these cities, but the Canaanites persisted in dwelling in this land.
And when the children of Israel became strong, they made the Canaanites [xref]a[/xref]forced labor; but they did not utterly dispossess them.

Then the children of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, Why have you given me an inheritance of [i]only[/i] one lot and one [xref]a[/xref]portion, although I am still a numerous people, whom Jehovah has thus far blessed?

And Joshua said to them, If you are a numerous people, go up to the forest, and cut out land there for yourself in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim; since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.

And the children of Joseph said, The hill country is not enough for us; and all the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have [xref]a[/xref]chariots of iron, both those of Beth-shean and its towns and those in the valley of Jezreel.
And Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, saying, You are a numerous people, and you have great strength; you shall not have one lot [i]only,[/i]

But the hill country shall be yours. Though it is a forest, you shall cut it down, and its end will be yours; for you shall dispossess the Canaanites, though they have chariots of iron [i]and[/i] though they are strong.
And the whole assembly of the children of Israel gathered together at [xref]a[/xref]Shiloh, and they set up the [xref]b[/xref]Tent of Meeting there; and the land was subdued before them.
And among the children of Israel there remained seven tribes whose inheritance had not been divided to them.
And Joshua said to the children of Israel, How long will you be slack about going to take possession of the land that Jehovah, the God of your fathers, has given you?

Appoint three men for each tribe, and I will send them out. And they shall rise up and go through the land, and write a description of it with a view to [i]its being[/i] their inheritance; and they shall come to me.
And they shall divide it into seven portions: Judah shall stay at his border on the south, and the house of Joseph shall stay at their border on the north.
And you shall describe the land in seven portions and bring [i]the description[/i] here to me, then I will [note]1[/note]cast lots for you here before Jehovah our God.
verse.note: See note [link]2[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 14[/link].

verse.text: But the [xref]a[/xref]Levites shall have no portion among you, for the priesthood of Jehovah is their inheritance. And [xref]b[/xref]Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh received their inheritance across the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of Jehovah had given to them.

And the men rose up and went; and Joshua commanded those who went to describe the land, saying, Go and walk through the land, and describe it; then return to me, and I will cast lots for you before Jehovah here in Shiloh.
So the men went, and they passed through the land and described it by cities into seven portions in a book. Then they came to Joshua at the camp at Shiloh.
And Joshua cast [xref]a[/xref]lots for them in Shiloh before Jehovah. And there Joshua divided the land to the children of Israel according to their divisions.
And the lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came out, according to their families. And the border of their lot went between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.

[xref]a[/xref]And their border on the northern side was from the Jordan, and the border went up alongside Jericho on the north, and went up through the hill country westward, and its end was at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
And from there the border passed to Luz, on the southern side of Luz (this is [xref]a[/xref]Bethel); and the border went down to Ataroth-addar, at the mountain which is south of Lower Beth-horon.

And the border turned [i]from there[/i] and went around the west side southward, from the mountain that is to the south of Beth-horon; and its end was at Kiriath-baal (this is Kiriath-jearim), a city of the children of Judah. This was the west side.
[xref]a[/xref]The south side was from the limit of Kiriath-jearim, and the border went [i]from the[/i] west and went to the fountain of the waters of Nephtoah;

And the border went down to the limit of the mountain that is before the [note]1[/note]Valley of Ben-hinnom, which is north of the valley of the Rephaim; and it went down into the [xref]a[/xref]Valley of Hinnom, to the southern side of the Jebusite slope, and went down to En-rogel,
verse.note: See note [link]8[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 15[/link].

verse.text: And turned north, and went to En-shemesh, and went to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim; and it went down to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben;
And it passed by the side before the Arabah northward, and went down to the Arabah;
And the border passed by the northern side of Beth-hoglah, and the end of the border was at the northern bay of the Salt Sea at the south end of the Jordan. This was the southern border.
And the Jordan borders it on the east side. This was the inheritance of the children of Benjamin according to their families, according to its borders all around.
And the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin according to their families were [xref]a[/xref]Jericho and Beth-hoglah and Emek-keziz
And Beth-arabah and Zemaraim and [xref]a[/xref]Bethel
And Avvim and Parah and Ophrah
And Chephar-ammoni and Ophni and Geba: twelve cities with their villages.
Gibeon and Ramah and Beeroth
And Mizpeh and Chephirah and Mozah
And Rekem and Irpeel and Taralah

And Zelah, Haeleph, and [i]that of the[/i] [xref]a[/xref]Jebusite (this is [note]1[/note]Jerusalem), Gibeath, Kiriath: fourteen cities with their villages. This was the inheritance of the children of Benjamin according to their families.
verse.note: Jerusalem was located in the land of Benjamin but was inherited by the children of Judah ([link]15:63[/link]).

verse.text: And the second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of the children of Simeon, according to their families. And their inheritance was in the [xref]a[/xref]midst of the inheritance of the children of Judah.
[xref]a[/xref]And they had for their inheritance Beer-sheba, or Sheba, and Moladah
And Hazar-shual and Balah and Ezem
And Eltolad and Bethul and Hormah
And Ziklag and Beth-marcaboth and Hazar-susah
And Beth-lebaoth and Sharuhen: thirteen cities with their villages.
Ain, Rimmon, and Ether, and Ashan: four cities with their villages.

And all the villages which were around these cities as far as Baalath-beer, [i]that is,[/i] Ramah of the Negev. This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families.

Out of the portion of the children of Judah was the inheritance of the children of Simeon because the portion of the children of Judah was too large for them; thus the children of Simeon received an inheritance in the [xref]a[/xref]midst of their inheritance.
And the third lot came up for the children of [xref]a[/xref]Zebulun according to their families. And the border of their inheritance was as far as Sarid;
And their border went up to the west, even to Maralah, and reached Dabbesheth; and it reached the brook that is before Jokneam.
And it turned from Sarid eastward toward the rising of the sun to the border of Chisloth-tabor, and went to Daberath and up to Japhia;
And from there it passed eastward toward the rising [i]of the sun[/i] to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin, and went to Rimmon, where it turned to Neah;
And the border went around from the north to Hannathon; and its end was the valley of Iphtahel,
With Kattath and Nahalal and Shimron and Idalah and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.
This was the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.
For Issachar the fourth lot came out, for the children of Issachar according to their families.
And their territory was Jezreel and Chesulloth and Shunem
And Hapharaim and Shion and Anaharath
And Rabbith and Kishion and Ebez
And Remeth and En-gannim and En-haddah and Beth-pazzez;
And the border reached [xref]a[/xref]Tabor and Shahazumah and Beth-shemesh; and the end of their border was at the Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.
This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families, the cities with their villages.
And the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.
And their territory was Helkath and Hali and Beten and Achshaph
And Allammelech and Amad and Mishal; and it reached [xref]a[/xref]Carmel on the west and Shihor-libnath;
And it turned toward the rising of the sun to Beth-dagon, and reached Zebulun and the valley of Iphtahel northward to Beth-emek and Neiel, and went to Cabul on the north
And Ebron and Rehob and Hammon and Kanah as far as Great [xref]a[/xref]Sidon;
And the border turned to Ramah and as far as the fortified city of [xref]a[/xref]Tyre; and the border turned to Hosah; and its end was at the sea at the region of Achzib;
And Ummah and Aphek and Rehob: twenty-two cities with their villages.
This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families, these cities with their villages.
For the children of [xref]a[/xref]Naphtali the sixth lot came out, for the children of Naphtali according to their families.
And their border was from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim, and Adami-nekeb and Jabneel unto Lakkum; and its end was the Jordan;
And the border turned westward to Aznoth-tabor, and went from there to Hukkok, and reached Zebulun on the south, and reached Asher on the west and Judah at the Jordan toward the rising of the sun;
And the fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath and Chinnereth
And Adamah and Ramah and [xref]a[/xref]Hazor
And Kedesh and Edrei and En-hazor
And Iron and Migdal-el, Horem and Beth-anath and Beth-shemesh: nineteen cities with their villages.
This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families, the cities with their villages.
The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families.
And the territory of their inheritance was [xref]a[/xref]Zorah and Eshtaol and Ir-shemesh
And Shaalabbin and Aijalon and Ithlah
And Elon and Timnah and Ekron
And Eltekeh and Gibbethon and Baalath
And Jehud and Bene-berak and Gath-rimmon
And Me-jarkon and Rakkon with the border opposite [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Japho.
verse.note: The same place as Joppa ([link]Acts 10:5[/link]).

verse.text: When the territory of the [xref]a[/xref]children of Dan was lost to them, the children of Dan went up and fought against [note]1[/note]Leshem; and they took it and struck it with the edge of the sword; and they took possession of it and inhabited it; and they called Leshem Dan, according to the name of Dan their father.
verse.note: I.e., Laish of [link]Judg. 18:29[/link], at the extreme north of the good land.

verse.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, these cities with their villages.
So they finished distributing the land as inheritances according to its borders. And the children of Israel gave Joshua the son of Nun an inheritance in the midst of them;
According to the commandment of Jehovah they gave him the city that he asked for, [i]that is,[/i] [xref]a[/xref]Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim. And he built up the city and dwelt in it.

These are the inheritances that [xref]a[/xref]Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the heads of the fathers' [i]houses[/i] of the tribes of the children of Israel gave as inheritances by lot in [xref]b[/xref]Shiloh before Jehovah at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. So they finished dividing the land.
Then Jehovah spoke to Joshua, saying,
Speak to the children of Israel, saying, Designate the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]cities of refuge, concerning which I spoke to you through Moses,
verse.note: See note [link]6[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 35[/link].

verse.text: So that the manslayer who kills a person by mistake [i]and[/i] unwittingly may flee there. And they will be to you as a refuge from the [xref]a[/xref]avenger of blood.

And he shall flee to one of these cities and stand at the entrance of the gate of the city and declare his cause in the ears of the elders of that city. And they shall take him into the city to themselves and give him a place; and he shall dwell among them.
And if the avenger of blood pursues after him, they shall not deliver the manslayer into his hand, for he struck his neighbor unwittingly and had not hated him previously.

And [xref]a[/xref]he shall dwell in that city until he can stand before the assembly for a judgment, until the death of the high priest who is at that time; then the manslayer shall return and enter into his own city and into his own house, into the city from which he fled.
And they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali and Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and Kiriath-arba (this is Hebron) in the [xref]a[/xref]hill country of Judah.

And across the Jordan at Jericho, to the east, they designated Bezer in the wilderness on the plain out of the tribe of Reuben and Ramoth in Gilead out of the tribe of Gad and Golan in Bashan out of the tribe of Manasseh.

These were the appointed cities for all the children of Israel and for the sojourner who sojourned among them, so that anyone who killed a person by mistake might flee there and not die at the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the assembly.

Then the heads of the fathers' [i]houses[/i] of the Levites approached [xref]a[/xref]Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the heads of the fathers' [i]houses[/i] of the tribes of the children of Israel,

And they spoke to them in [xref]a[/xref]Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, Jehovah commanded through Moses that we be given cities to dwell in with their [xref]b[/xref]pasture lands for our cattle.
So the children of Israel gave the Levites, according to the commandment of Jehovah, these cities with their pasture lands out of their inheritance:

And the lot came out for the families of the Kohathites. And to the [xref]a[/xref]children of Aaron the priest who were of the Levites there went by lot thirteen cities out of the tribe of Judah and out of the tribe of the Simeonites and out of the tribe of Benjamin.
And to the [xref]a[/xref]rest of the children of Kohath there went by lot ten cities out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim and out of the tribe of Dan and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh.

And to the [xref]a[/xref]children of Gershon there went by lot thirteen cities out of the families of the tribe of Issachar and out of the tribe of Asher and out of the tribe of Naphtali and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
To the [xref]a[/xref]children of Merari according to their families there went twelve cities out of the tribe of Reuben and out of the tribe of Gad and out of the tribe of Zebulun.
So the children of Israel gave by lot to the Levites these cities with their pasture lands, as Jehovah had commanded through Moses.
[xref]a[/xref]And out of the tribe of the children of Judah and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon they gave these cities, which are here mentioned by name;
[xref]a[/xref]And they went to the children of Aaron, [i]one[/i] of the families of the Kohathites, of the children of Levi; for the first lot was theirs.
And they gave them Kiriath-arba ([i]Arba[/i] was the father of Anak), which is Hebron, in the [xref]a[/xref]hill country of Judah, with its pasture lands around it.
But the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for his possession.
And to the children of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the manslayer; and Libnah with its pasture lands
And Jattir with its pasture lands and Eshtemoa with its pasture lands
And Holon with its pasture lands and Debir with its pasture lands
And Ain with its pasture lands and Juttah with its pasture lands [i]and[/i] Beth-shemesh with its pasture lands: nine cities out of those two tribes.
And out of the tribe of Benjamin, Gibeon with its pasture lands, Geba with its pasture lands,
Anathoth with its pasture lands, and Almon with its pasture lands: four cities.
All the cities of the children of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their pasture lands.
[xref]a[/xref]And as for the families of the children of Kohath, the Levites who remained of the children of Kohath, the cities of their lot out of the tribe of Ephraim were [i]given.[/i]
And they gave them Shechem with its pasture lands in the hill country of Ephraim, the city of refuge for the manslayer; and Gezer with its pasture lands
And Kibzaim with its pasture lands and Beth-horon with its pasture lands: four cities.
And out of the tribe of Dan: Eltekeh with its pasture lands, Gibbethon with its pasture lands,
Aijalon with its pasture lands, Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands: four cities.
And out of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Taanach with its pasture lands and Gath-rimmon with its pasture lands: two cities.
All the cities for the families of the children of Kohath who remained were ten, with their pasture lands.

[xref]a[/xref]And to the children of Gershon, [i]one[/i] of the families of the Levites, [i]they gave,[/i] out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the manslayer; and Be-eshterah with its pasture lands: two cities.
And out of the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,
Jarmuth with its pasture lands, En-gannim with its pasture lands: four cities.
And out of the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,
Helkath with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands: four cities.

And out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the manslayer; and Hammoth-dor with its pasture lands and Kartan with its pasture lands: three cities.
All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families were thirteen cities, with their pasture lands.
[xref]a[/xref]And to the families of the children of Merari, the rest of the Levites, out of the tribe of Zebulun, [i]they gave[/i] Jokneam with its pasture lands and Kartah with its pasture lands,
Dimnah with its pasture lands, Nahalal with its pasture lands: four cities.
[note]1[/note]And out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer with its pasture lands and Jahaz with its pasture lands,
verse.note: [link]Verses 36-37[/link] are not found in some MSS.

verse.text: Kedemoth with its pasture lands and Mephaath with its pasture lands: four cities.
And out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, the city of refuge for the manslayer; and Mahanaim with its pasture lands,
Heshbon with its pasture lands, Jazer with its pasture lands: four cities in all.
[i]These were[/i] all the cities for the children of Merari according to their families, which remained of the families of the Levites; and their lot was twelve cities.
All the cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the children of Israel were [xref]a[/xref]forty-eight cities with their pasture lands.
Each of these cities had its pasture lands around it; so it was with all these cities.
So Jehovah gave Israel all the land that He had [xref]a[/xref]sworn to give to their fathers, and they possessed it and dwelt in it.

And Jehovah gave them rest all around, according to all that He had sworn to their fathers. And no one among all their enemies could [xref]a[/xref]stand before them; Jehovah delivered all their enemies into their hand.
[xref]a[/xref]Not a word failed of all the good things that Jehovah had spoken to the house of Israel; all came to pass.
Then Joshua called the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
And he said to them, You have kept all that Moses the servant of Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]commanded you, and you have listened to my voice in all that I have commanded you.
You have not forsaken your brothers these many days unto this day, but have kept the charge of the commandment of Jehovah your God.

And now Jehovah your God has given your brothers [xref]a[/xref]rest as He promised them. And now [note]1[/note]turn and go to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of Jehovah gave you [xref]b[/xref]across the Jordan.
verse.note: After Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had fought along with their brothers, they were qualified to return to their land to enjoy their inheritance. This indicates that we cannot enjoy Christ without the Body. We must be one with the Body in order to share the inheritance of Christ ([link]1 Cor. 12:13[/link]; [link]Eph. 3:6[/link]).

verse.text: However be very careful to perform the commandment and the law which Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded you, to [xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God and to walk in all His ways and to keep His commandments and to cling to Him and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
And Joshua blessed them and sent them away; and they went to their tents.

Now to the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given [i]an inheritance[/i] in Bashan, and to the other half of it Joshua gave [i]an inheritance[/i] with their brothers across the Jordan on the west. Furthermore, when Joshua sent them away to their tents and blessed them,

He spoke to them, saying, Return with many riches to your tents and with very many cattle, with silver and with gold and with bronze and with iron and with very much clothing; [xref]a[/xref]divide the spoil of your enemies with your brothers.

So the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh went; and they departed from among the children of Israel out of [xref]a[/xref]Shiloh, which was in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they had taken possession of according to the commandment of Jehovah through Moses.

And when they came into the region of the Jordan that is in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an [note]1[/note]altar there at the Jordan, an altar great in appearance.
verse.note: In God's economy, among God's people there was to be only one altar, in Jerusalem. All God's people had to go there to offer their sacrifices to God for their worship and fellowship with God ([link]Deut. 12:5-8[/link]). The record at the end of this chapter concerning the building of another altar at the Jordan by the two and a half tribes indicates that in the enjoyment of Christ division must be avoided to the uttermost. To enjoy the all-inclusive Christ as the good land, we must be one people, one Body, one universal church to testify for Christ. See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in Deut. 12[/link].

verse.text: And the children of Israel heard [i]the report,[/i] which said, Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar out in front of the land of Canaan, in the region of the Jordan, on the side of the children of Israel.
And when the children of Israel heard [i]this,[/i] all the assembly of the children of Israel [xref]a[/xref]gathered together at Shiloh to go up in battle against them.
And the children of Israel sent [xref]a[/xref]Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead,
And with him ten leaders, one [xref]a[/xref]leader each to a fathers' house of all the tribes of Israel; and they were each the head of their fathers' houses among the thousands of Israel.
And they went to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and spoke to them, saying,

Thus says all the assembly of Jehovah, What is this trespass that you have committed against the God of Israel in turning this day from following after Jehovah by building yourselves an [xref]a[/xref]altar to rebel against Jehovah this day?
Was the iniquity of [xref]a[/xref]Peor too little for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves unto this day, though there was a plague upon the assembly of Jehovah,
That you have turned this day from following after Jehovah? And now, if you rebel against Jehovah this day, tomorrow He will be angry with the whole assembly of Israel.

But if the land of your possession is unclean, cross over into the land of the possession of Jehovah, [xref]a[/xref]where Jehovah's tabernacle dwells, and take a possession in the midst of us. But do not rebel against Jehovah, nor rebel against us, by building yourselves an altar besides the altar of Jehovah our God.

Did not [xref]a[/xref]Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in [i]the matter of[/i] the devoted thing? But there was wrath upon the whole assembly of Israel, and that one man did not perish alone for his iniquity.
Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered and said to the heads of the thousands of Israel,

The Mighty One, God Jehovah; the Mighty One, God Jehovah; He [xref]a[/xref]knows, and may Israel itself know, whether it was in rebellion, or whether it was in trespass against Jehovah — may You not save us today —

That we built an altar for ourselves to turn away from following after Jehovah; or if [i]we did so[/i] to offer burnt offerings and meal offerings upon it or to make sacrifices of peace offerings upon it, may Jehovah Himself require [i]it.[/i]

But truly we have done this for a reason [i]and[/i] out of a concern that in the future your [xref]a[/xref]children might speak to our children, saying, What have you to do with Jehovah the God of Israel?

For Jehovah has made the Jordan a border between us and you, O children of Reuben and children of Gad. You have no portion in Jehovah. Thus your children would cause our children to cease fearing Jehovah.
Therefore we said, Let us now take action to build the altar, [i]though[/i] not for burnt offering or for sacrifice;

But it will be a [xref]a[/xref]witness between us and between you, and between our generations after us, that we may do the service of Jehovah [xref]b[/xref]before Him with our burnt offerings and our sacrifices and our peace offerings, and that your children may not say in the future to our children, You have no portion in Jehovah.

And we said, When they say [i]this[/i] to us and to our generations in the future, we will say, Look at the copy of the altar of Jehovah that our fathers made, [i]though[/i] not for burnt offering or for sacrifice; but it is a witness between us and you.

Far be it from us that we would rebel against Jehovah and turn away today from following after Jehovah by building an altar for burnt offering, for meal offering, or for sacrifice, besides the altar of Jehovah our God, which is before His tabernacle!

And when Phinehas the priest and the leaders of the assembly and the heads of the thousands of Israel who were with him heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spoke, it seemed good in their sight.

And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh, Today we know that Jehovah is in the [xref]a[/xref]midst of us, because you have not committed this trespass against Jehovah. Now you have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of Jehovah.

So Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest and the leaders returned from the children of Reuben and the children of Gad, from the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel; and they brought back word to them.

And the matter seemed good in the sight of the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God and never spoke [i]again[/i] of going up in battle against them to destroy the land in which the children of Reuben and the children of Gad dwelt.
And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad named the altar; for, [i]they said,[/i] it is a [xref]a[/xref]witness between us that Jehovah is God.
And many days after Jehovah had given Israel [xref]a[/xref]rest from all their enemies around [i]them[/i] and Joshua was [xref]b[/xref]old [i]and[/i] advanced in age,
Joshua [xref]a[/xref]called for all Israel, for their elders and their heads and their judges and their officers; and he said to them, I am old and advanced in age;
And you have [xref]a[/xref]seen all that Jehovah your God has done to all these nations because of you, for it was Jehovah your God who [xref]b[/xref]fought for you.

See, I have [xref]a[/xref]allotted to you all these nations that remain as an inheritance for your tribes, as well as all the nations that I cut off, from the Jordan to the Great Sea toward the setting of the sun.
And Jehovah your God, He will [xref]a[/xref]thrust them out before you and dispossess them out of your sight; and you will [xref]b[/xref]possess their land, as Jehovah your God spoke to you.
Therefore be very strong to keep and do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, not turning away from it to the right or to the left,

[i]And[/i] not going unto these nations, these that remain with you; neither shall you make [xref]a[/xref]mention of the names of their gods, nor cause [i]anyone[/i] to swear [i]by them,[/i] nor serve them, nor bow down to them;
But you shall [xref]a[/xref]cling to Jehovah your God, as you have done to this day.
For Jehovah has [xref]a[/xref]dispossessed great and strong nations because of you; but as for you, no one has stood before you to this day.
One man of you [xref]a[/xref]chases a thousand, for it is Jehovah your God who [xref]b[/xref]fights for you, as He has spoken to you.
Be very careful therefore for yourselves, that you [note]1[/note]love Jehovah your God.
verse.note: See note [link]6[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 20[/link].

verse.text: But if you do indeed turn back and cling to the remainder of these nations, these that remain with you, and [xref]a[/xref]marry into them, and go among them and they among you;

Know for certain that Jehovah your God will no longer [xref]a[/xref]dispossess these nations out of your sight, but they will become a snare and a trap to you, and a scourge in your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that Jehovah your God has given you.

And now today I am [xref]a[/xref]going the way of all the earth; and you know in all your hearts and in all your souls that not a word has [xref]b[/xref]failed of all the good things that Jehovah your God spoke concerning you. All has come to pass for you; not one word of it has failed.

But just as all the good things that Jehovah your God spoke concerning you have come upon you, so will Jehovah cause all the [xref]a[/xref]evil things to come upon you, until He has destroyed you from this good land that Jehovah your God has given you.

When you transgress the covenant of Jehovah your God, which He commanded you, and go and serve other gods, and bow down to them, the anger of Jehovah will burn against you, and you will [xref]a[/xref]perish quickly from the good land that He has given you.

Then Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel together at Shechem; and he called for the elders of Israel and for their heads and for their judges and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.

And Joshua said to all the people, Thus says Jehovah the God of Israel, Your fathers dwelt across the [note]1[/note]River long ago, [xref]a[/xref]Terah the father of Abraham and the father of Nahor; and they served other gods.
verse.note: I.e., the Euphrates. So throughout this chapter.

verse.text: And I took your father [xref]a[/xref]Abraham from across the River and brought him throughout all the land of [xref]b[/xref]Canaan; and I multiplied his seed and gave him [xref]c[/xref]Isaac.
And I gave [xref]a[/xref]Jacob and Esau to Isaac. And I gave [xref]b[/xref]Mount Seir to Esau, that he might possess it; but Jacob and his sons went down into [xref]c[/xref]Egypt.
And I [xref]a[/xref]sent Moses and Aaron, and I [xref]b[/xref]plagued Egypt by what I did in the midst of it; and afterward I [xref]c[/xref]brought you out.
And I brought your fathers out from Egypt, and you came to the [xref]a[/xref]sea; and the Egyptians [xref]b[/xref]pursued after your fathers with chariots and with horsemen unto the Red Sea.

And when they [xref]a[/xref]cried out to Jehovah, He put deep [xref]b[/xref]darkness between you and the Egyptians; and He brought the sea upon them and [xref]c[/xref]covered them. And your eyes saw what I did to Egypt. And you dwelt in the [xref]d[/xref]wilderness for many days.

And I brought you into the [xref]a[/xref]land of the Amorites, who dwelt beyond the Jordan, and they fought with you. And I gave them into your hand, and you possessed their land; and I destroyed them before you.
Then [xref]a[/xref]Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, rose up and fought against Israel; and he sent [i]men[/i] and called for [xref]b[/xref]Balaam the son of Beor to curse you.
But I would not listen to Balaam; therefore he altogether [xref]a[/xref]blessed you, and I delivered you out of his hand.

And you [xref]a[/xref]crossed over the Jordan and came to [xref]b[/xref]Jericho; and the lords of Jericho fought against you, [i]and also[/i] the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Girgashites [i]and[/i] the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I gave them into your hand.
And I sent the [xref]a[/xref]hornet before you, and it drove them out from before you, [i]that is,[/i] the two kings of the Amorites; [i]it was[/i] not by your [xref]b[/xref]sword or by your bow.
And I gave you a land on which you had not labored, and cities which you did not [xref]a[/xref]build, and you dwell in them; you eat of vineyards and olive groves which you did not plant.
Now therefore fear Jehovah, and [xref]a[/xref]serve Him in sincerity and faithfulness; and put away the gods whom your fathers served across the River and in Egypt, and serve Jehovah.

And [xref]a[/xref]if it seems wrong in your sight to serve Jehovah, choose for yourselves today whom you will serve, either the gods [i]from[/i] across the River, whom your fathers served, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell. But [xref]b[/xref]as for me and my house, we will serve Jehovah.
And the people answered and said, Far be it from us that we would forsake Jehovah to serve other gods;

For Jehovah our God is the One who brought us and our fathers out from the land of Egypt, from the [xref]a[/xref]slave house, and who did those great signs in our sight and preserved us in all the way that we went and among all the peoples through whose midst we passed;
And Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]drove out all the peoples from before us, that is, the Amorites who inhabit the land. We also will serve Jehovah, for He is our God.
Then Joshua said to the people, You are not able to serve Jehovah, for He is a [xref]a[/xref]holy God. He is a [xref]b[/xref]jealous God; He will not forgive your transgression or your sins.
If you forsake Jehovah and serve foreign gods, He will turn and do you harm and consume you after He has done good to you.
And the people said to Joshua, No; but we will serve Jehovah.
Then Joshua said to the people, You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen Jehovah on your own, to serve Him. And they said, [i]We are[/i] witnesses.
Now therefore [xref]a[/xref]put away the foreign gods that are among you, and incline your hearts to Jehovah the God of Israel.
And the people said to Joshua, Jehovah our God we will serve, and to His voice we will listen.
So Joshua made a [xref]a[/xref]covenant for the people that day, and he made a statute and an ordinance for them in Shechem.
And Joshua [xref]a[/xref]wrote these words in the book of the law of God, and he took a great [xref]b[/xref]stone and erected it there under the terebinth that was at the sanctuary of Jehovah.

And Joshua said to all the people, This stone here shall be as a [xref]a[/xref]witness against us; for it has heard all the words of Jehovah, which He has spoken to us; and it shall be as a witness against you, lest you act deceptively against your God.
Then Joshua sent the people away, each to his own inheritance.
[xref]a[/xref]And after these things Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Jehovah, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.
And they buried him in the territory of his inheritance, in Timnath-serah, which is in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.

[xref]a[/xref]And Israel served Jehovah throughout all the days of Joshua and throughout all the days of the elders whose days extended after Joshua's and who knew all the work of Jehovah that He had done for Israel.

And Joseph's [xref]a[/xref]bones, which the children of Israel had brought up from Egypt, were buried in Shechem, in the portion of the field that Jacob had [xref]b[/xref]bought from the children of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of money; and [note]1[/note]it became the [xref]c[/xref]inheritance of the children of Joseph.
verse.note: Lit., they.

verse.text: And [xref]a[/xref]Eleazar the son of Aaron died; and they buried him in [note]1[/note]the hill of Phinehas his son, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim.
verse.note: Or, Gibeah.
